bibl.title: Despatch from Owen L. W. Smith to David J. Hill, January 25, 1900
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

correspAction.roleName: U.S. Minister Resident and Consul General

p.add: ACKNOWLEDGED MAR 27 1900 Bureau of Foreign Commerce.

div1.p: No. 44, Consular. Legation of the United States, Monrovia Liberia, Jan. 25, 1900.

p.add: INDEX BUREAU REC'D '00 DEPT OF STATE

div1.p: Hon. David J. Hill, Assistant Secretary of State, Washington.

Sir: I have the honor to say, that the present session of the Liberian Legislature, in order, to prevent smuggling; and the better to secure the collection of import duties, has enacted a law, for the erection and establishment of bonded warehouses, in every port of entry.
Prior to this; much visiting steamers, while they lay in port; purchasing from and trading with the crews thereof, without an honest payment of the import duties.
I have the honor to be your obedient servant; Owen L. W. Smith, M. R. and C. General.
